article.headline: Pennsylvania 69, Yale 61
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Mark Zoller scored eight of his 12 points in the last seven minutes to lead Penn to a 69-61 victory over Yale on Saturday night. Charlie Copp had 12 points and Adam Chubb and Tim Begley 10 each for Penn (13-9, 6-3 Ivy), while Dominick Martin had a career-high 20 points for the Bulldogs (9-14, 4-6). The Quakers held a 45-36 lead with 9:38 to play before Martin sparked a Yale rally that cut the lead to 50-48 on two free throws by Edwin Draughan. Copp then hit a 3-point shot, and Zoller scored five straight points, giving the Quakers a 58-48 edge with four minutes left. Yale never got closer than seven points. Yale built a 19-13 lead early, as Penn missed on 15 of its first 19 shots. Ryan Pettinella and Ibrahim Jaaber then scored six points each during a 19-3 run, which gave Penn a 32-22 advantage at halftime, and the team never trailed again. It was the 200th meeting between the schools, with Penn now holding a 135-65 edge in the all-time series.
